alert.note: Alert for Daviess; Gibson; Knox; Pike (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 30 at 11:29AM EDT until April 06 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... East Fork White River from Bedford to Shoals. White River from Elliston to Hazleton. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana... East Fork White River near Rivervale. White River at Edwardsport. .Widespread lowland flooding continues along the White River at Elliston to all points downstream...and along the East Fork White River from near Bedford to all points downstream. Moderate flooding has begun at Petersburg...and will continue along the lower White River through Sunday. The crest on the White River will continue along the Knox...Daviess County line through Friday. Flooding will likely last through Friday along Greene County portions of the White River...and through next week along lower portions of the White River. The crest on the East Fork White River will pass Bedford later today with minor flooding continuing for areas downstream through early next week. Rain going into this weekend may extend flooding. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White River at Edwardsport. * WHEN...Until Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...At 22.9 feet, A 25 foot section of Levee Unit 8 failed at this level on March 6 2011...flooding local roads behind the levee. Flooding not nearly as bad as June 2008 levee failure. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 AM EDT Thursday /6:00 AM CDT Thursday/ the stage was 21.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:00 AM EDT Thursday /6:00 AM CDT Thursday/ was 22.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall below flood stage Sunday afternoon to 13.9 feet Monday evening. It will then rise above flood stage late Tuesday evening to 15.5 feet Wednesday evening. It will fall below flood stage again Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
